abstract: Jack Baker and Michael McConnell maintain they are country's first same-sex couple to legally marry, having done so in 1971; while state and federal governments have yet to confirm that status, couple, now in their 70s, were definitely first to apply for a marriage license, helping to make their home state of Minnesota an early hub of gay activism.
lead_paragraph: With some legal sleight of hand, Jack Baker and Michael McConnell obtained a marriage license in Minnesota four decades before the state legalized same-sex unions.

headline.main: The Same-Sex Couple Who Got a Marriage License in 1971
headline.print_headline: Same-Sex Marriage? Done That, Back in 1971

snippet: With some legal sleight of hand, Jack Baker and Michael McConnell obtained a marriage license in Minnesota four decades before the state legalized same-sex unions.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
